Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement on murders - "crossing red light? eh, that guy got what he deserved. I'm fining him 75 USD and demanding he pay for his own funeral ." Whereas in Holland people develop a kind of selfless first respond 'live and let live' attitude.
